borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The scale, siting and design of the proposed development is incongruous in its location and is&nbsp; considered harmful to the character and appearance of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</p>

<p>The scale, siting and design of the proposed rear development would would appear disproportionate in relation to the size of the rear curtilage and the original dwellinghouse. The development would result in an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers (in particular no. 28 Lymington Road), therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy D4 and D8 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>-&nbsp; Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020).</p>

<p>The proposed side and front extensions would appear incongruous and unsettle the symmetry, character and appearance of the street scene along Lymington Road and harm the established architectural character of the Becontree Estate.&nbsp; As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</p>
description: Construction of a single storey rear and front extension.
